text: Further , monocytes from patients demonstrate an augmented susceptibility to a productive infection with HIV-1 in vitro .
Mycobacterium tuberculosis and its components are strong signals to activate monocytes to production of cytokines .
In this study we examined the basis of activation of monocytes during active tuberculosis and by M . tuberculosis .

We found a constitutive degradation of <extra_id_0> I kappa B-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the major cytoplasmic inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa B ( NF-kappa B ) , in freshly isolated PBMC and monocytes from patients with tuberculosis .

text: In contrast , <extra_id_0> I kappa B-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels in PBMC and monocytes from healthy subjects or from patients with nontuberculous pulmonary conditions were intact .

text: Further , by electrophoretic mobility shift assay , NF-kappa B was activated in monocytes from tuberculous patients .

The expression of <extra_id_0> I kappa B-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , which is responsive to activation by NF-kappa B , was up-regulated in PBMC and monocytes from patients , but not in mononuclear cells from healthy subjects or those with nontuberculous lung diseases .
